data.text:
SUNDAY

Grocery Trip to Pueblo Super Market 11am meet on the dock and tell the ferry captain you are going on the grocery run. Sign up by 10am so we can be sure our driver is available. (Taxi is $7 per person round trip.)

TUESDAY (Contact Harbormaster at 340-719-5438)

All U-Can-Eat Beach Barbeque 7 til 10 at the Harbormaster Restaurant. A West Indian Feast, complete with Steel Band, broken bottle dancer, limbo artist, a fire eater and a Mocko Jumbie, one of the Virgin Islands renowned stilt dancers. Prices start at $30 for this wonderful all-you-can-eat buffet.

Island Tour with Rudi 10am on King Street near the Tradewinds shop (Three blocks down on King Street). His minimum is four people. Rudi’s Tour includes stops to three of four locations. Pick your choice of The Cruzan Rum Distillery, The Whim Greathouse Plantation Museum, The Botanical Gardens, and Frederiksted ($25 per person, does not include admission prices). Cancellations: Please call Rudi at 514-4600. (If Wednesday is better, see next page.)

WEDNESDAY

Island Tour with Sweeney 10am on King Street. Sweeney gives you a tour full of insights to the island that only a West Indian can share. See St. Croix, including Christiansted, Frederiksted, The Cruzan Rum Distillery, Whim Greathouse Plantation Museum, The Botanical Gardens, Columbus Landing, and, if you ask him nicely, the Domino Club in the Rainforest, home of the legendary beer drinking pig. Tour leaves from King Street in front of The Tradewinds shop at 10am and returns around 3:30 (Cruzan Time). Sign up on the bulletin board outside the lobby by Monday. The tour costs $65 and includes admission prices. Sign up by Tuesday in the lobby. Cancellations: Please call Sweeney at 340-773-6700.

While we have never had any major problems with any of our programs, all activities here are undertaken at your own risk and with no liability assumed by Hotel on the Cay.

DAILY: ST. CROIX WATERSPORTS CENTER (340-773-7060 www.stcroixwatersports.com)

The best kept secret at Hotel on the Cay is St. Croix Water Sports Center. Located on the west side of the hotel beach and winners of the four water sports categories in 2010! Best Water Sports, Best Jet Ski Tours, Best Tourist Activities, and Best Local Tours.

Guided jet ski tours on top-of-the-line cruisers: magnificent vistas, secluded coral gardens. Please check at the beach shack for jet ski snorkel tours, kayak tours to Altona Lagoon, as well as boat snorkel tours to Grewen Cay Island and the Sand Bar. Fun for the entire family. Windsurfing rentals and lessons, snorkel rentals, sales and tours, kayaks – rentals and tours, paddle boats, sailing. Island’s only professional windsurfing school. Fully stocked beach shop with sunscreen, reusable underwater cameras, rash guards, T-shirts, hats, beach jewelry, and more

Quality snorkel gear for rent or sale – try it before you buy it or make sure your rental is the right fit. Hourly, daily or weekly snorkel gear rentals available. We offer free snorkel mini-lessons and flotation devices for those renting our gear. Interesting shallow water habitat and drop off right off our beach.

“Excellent Service – Best Equipment!”
